channel.title: Hardc0re k1ck (midi version) --- for Hohum Labs Axoctrl
channel.description: ## hardc0re k1ck (midi version) is a midi-controllable version of the [original hardc0re k1ck](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/hardc0re-k1ck-for-hohum-labs-axoctrl/7236) patch with added functionalities, made to be controlled by the Hohum Labs Axoctrl. ## available for download here: hardc0re k1ck midi.axp (69.9 KB) original patch video (original version): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QEki-13pIAk18 new video coming soon for midi version Inspired by hardcore, speedcore & gabber music, the original **hardc0re k1ck** is an attempt to turn the Axoloti into a functional self-contained club-ready music box. It contains a kick drum synth (hard kick), distortion & glitch effects (neuro fx). The main difference is that **in the midi version, the pattern generator (aka ‘gener8r’) is now replaced by a midi control module (c0ntr0l)** With this version, you can play the kick & the cymbal with midi notes so that you’re not constrained to a set of patterns and you can sequence the midi by yourself. All differences/improvements: - playable via midi channel 1 as kick & channel 2 as cymbal - no internal pattern generator (use your own midi controller/sequencer) - additional high-pass filter on the cymbal - added VU meter - adjustable kick volume - decay env in neuro fx now triggered by both kick & cymbal (instead of just triggered by the kick) - better decay range in neuro fx ##This guide only focuses on using the 'c0ntr0l' page. The guide for using the _'hard kick' & 'neuro fx'_ can be found [here](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/hardc0re-k1ck-for-hohum-labs-axoctrl/7236?u=kelvint). ---------- ## **c0ntr0l** The kick drum is triggered either via midi channel 1 or by pressing the kick trigger button The cymbal is triggered either via midi channel 2 or by pressing the cymbal trigger button on the c0ntr0l page The "pitch" shows the midi note value of the kick * PC0: triggers the cymbal * kickvol: volume of kick (turn this down if the kick sound has covered the cymbal sound) * v>filt: kick velocity to filter amount * v>p env: kick velocity to kick pitch envelope amount * v>cym: cymbal velocity to volume amount * cym vol: volume of cymbal * hpf: high pass filter for the cymbal * env: envelope amount applied to the hpf * cym len: cymbal's decay time or length

item.title: Hardc0re k1ck (midi version) --- for Hohum Labs Axoctrl
item.dc:creator: @KelvinT KelvinT
item.description:
@KelvinT wrote:

hardc0re k1ck (midi version) is a midi-controllable version of the original hardc0re k1ck patch with added functionalities, made to be controlled by the Hohum Labs Axoctrl.

available for download here: hardc0re k1ck midi.axp (69.9 KB)

original patch video (original version): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QEki-13pIAk18
new video coming soon for midi version

Inspired by hardcore, speedcore & gabber music, the original hardc0re k1ck is an attempt to turn the Axoloti into a functional self-contained club-ready music box. It contains a kick drum synth (hard kick), distortion & glitch effects (neuro fx).

The main difference is that in the midi version, the pattern generator (aka ‘gener8r’) is now replaced by a midi control module (c0ntr0l)
With this version, you can play the kick & the cymbal with midi notes so that you’re not constrained to a set of patterns and you can sequence the midi by yourself.

All differences/improvements:
- playable via midi channel 1 as kick & channel 2 as cymbal
- no internal pattern generator (use your own midi controller/sequencer)
- additional high-pass filter on the cymbal
- added VU meter
- adjustable kick volume
- decay env in neuro fx now triggered by both kick & cymbal (instead of just triggered by the kick)
- better decay range in neuro fx

This guide only focuses on using the 'c0ntr0l' page. The guide for using the 'hard kick' & 'neuro fx' can be found here.

c0ntr0l

c0ntr0l.jpg2836x1774 367 KB

The kick drum is triggered either via midi channel 1 or by pressing the kick trigger button
The cymbal is triggered either via midi channel 2 or by pressing the cymbal trigger button on the c0ntr0l page
The "pitch" shows the midi note value of the kick

  • PC0: triggers the cymbal
  • kickvol: volume of kick (turn this down if the kick sound has covered the cymbal sound)
  • v>filt: kick velocity to filter amount
  • v>p env: kick velocity to kick pitch envelope amount
  • v>cym: cymbal velocity to volume amount
  • cym vol: volume of cymbal
  • hpf: high pass filter for the cymbal
  • env: envelope amount applied to the hpf
  • cym len: cymbal's decay time or length

Read full topic
item.source: Hardc0re k1ck (midi version) --- for Hohum Labs Axoctrl
